description.narrative:
The MSME Mentorship program has a long term goal of creating sustainable MSME business growth and jobs, with an intervention strategy of qualifying potential mentors into entering value adding relationships with entrepreneurs from the Micro Small & Medium Enterprise (MSME) sector. The program is in response to the 75% death rate of all start ¿ups within their 3 years of birth. We believe that indeed mentoring may be that kick which will save such enterprises from collapsing .
Furthermore, the program is in reference to the Danish Africa Commission focus on economic growth and employment creation, and in line with the 7th July 2010 deliberation organized by the Danish Embassy in Nairobi on the second version of the Business Sector Programme Support (BSPS II). Through a collaborative approach, the program shall be implemented in a two tier system of 6 month capacity building followed with a 12 month actual mentoring of enterprises by the trained mentors. The Regional Center for Enterprise Development (RCED) of Inoorero University shall host the program drawing experiences from both the academia (via highly qualified faculty) and Industry through collaboration with major players namely Entrepreneurs; Donor agencies: International Labour Organization ¿ Youth Entrepreneurship Facility, Danish Development Agency (ILO-YEF; DANIDA); Business Member Organizations: Kenya Private Sector Alliance; Eye Kenya; Africa Youth Trust; Enablis; Federation of Kenya Employers; Kenya Association of Business Owners (KEPSA; EYE KENYA; AYT; FKE; KAWBO); East Africa Business Council and Governments among other players.
